original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.8. Kusalattika, Sanidassanaduka🔽Abyākato sanidassano dhammo naabyākatassa nasanidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Abyākato sanidassano dhammo nakusalassa nasanidassanassa …pe…. (Cha pañhā🔽kātabbā.) Ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā tīṇi, upanissaye purejāte cha, atthiyā avigate cha.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  kusala attika sani dassana duka  abyākataḥ sa nidassanaḥ dhammaḥ na abyākatassa na sa nidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ abyākataḥ sa nidassanaḥ dhammaḥ na kusalassa na sa nidassanassa pe cha pañhā  kātabbā ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā tīṇi upanissaye purejāte cha atthiyā avigate cha
translated: The Triad on the Wholesome, the Triad on the Manifest🔽A non-defined, manifest idea is a condition, as object condition, for a non-defined, non-manifest idea. A non-defined, manifest idea is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome, non-manifest idea. … (Six questions are to be constructed in this way.) In the case of object, there are six; in the case of predominance, three; in the case of decisive support, in the case of prenascence, six; in the case of presence, in the case of non-disappearance, six.

original: Kusalaṁ anidassanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanidassano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalena tīṇiyeva. Abyākatena tīṇiyeva. Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: kusalam anidassanam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na anidassanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalena tīṇi eva abyākatena tīṇi eva hetuyā nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: With the wholesome, non-manifest idea as condition there arises a non-wholesome, non-manifest idea, a condition by way of root. There are only three with the unwholesome. There are only three with the non-defined. In the case of cause, there are nine. … In the case of result, there are three. … In the case of non-disappearance, there are nine.
